title.narrative: WASH SERVICES

description.narrative: Capacity of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) institutions at national and regional levels strengthened to plan, deliver, and monitor Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services for underserved populations, schools and health facilities including during humanitarian situations., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and their families have improved and equitable access to and utilize safe drinking water and sanitation services and adopt improved hygiene practices and behaviours

mailing-address.narrative: No. 5 Kofi Annan Street Cape Point Kombo St. Mary Private Mail Bag 85 Banjul

sector.narrative: Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)
Technical assistance--disaster risk reduction and / or climate change adaptation and / or environment
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity of WASH institutions at national and regional levels strengthened to plan, deliver, and monitor WASH services forunderserved populations, schools and health facilities including during humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF is committed to supporting The Gambia Government in attaining their commitments to ensuring equitable access to safe WASH services for all in line with the NDP and SDG Goal 6. With the support; from GCO to the WASH sector, people (74619 females and 71691 males);have gained access toand utilize safe drinking water, sanitation services and adopted improved hygiene practices and behaviors contributing to the national proportion of;90% population accessing improved accessing improved water resources, 62% improved sanitation facilities and 31% practicing hand washing with soap (MICS 2018).;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
